meanings.definition: More fleshy in appearance or texture.
meanings.sent1: The ripe peach looked fleshlier than the unripe one.
meanings.sent2: The butcher shop had a display of fleshlier cuts of meat.
meanings.sent3: The plush toy bear felt fleshlier after being stuffed with more cotton.
meanings.sent4: The garden in spring becomes fleshlier with blooming flowers.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the fleshlier details of the fruit perfectly.

meanings.sent1: The chef kneaded the dough fleshlier to ensure it rose well.
meanings.sent2: The dancer moved fleshlier during the slow part of the music.
meanings.sent3: The dog wagged its tail fleshlier when it smelled food cooking.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches swayed fleshlier in the wind after a heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The baby giggled as the parent tickled them fleshlier than usual.
